subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] new to group
msgSnippet: This is the best place for it. I recommend you download the Kingsley manual from this site. The hardest thing I ve found and what takes the most time is
messageBody:
This is the best place for it. I recommend you download the Kingsley manual from this site. The hardest thing I've found and what takes the most time is reading it, not writing it.
 
So writing in a diary is good, if you also go back and read it. The reading will allow you to recognize whole word forms instead of just working out the sounds of individual letters.
 
Another good way to learn it is through reading other's writings.
 
Chuck

aarons_bbgirl <aarons_bbgirl@...> wrote:
hi folks....  i am interested in learning this "Kingsley Read Alphabet"..

i have muscular dystrophy, and i think that this other alphabet might help me to
write more into my diary and little notes to myself...

you never know :-)

and besides, i am just a language/writing-systems geek, and i wanted to see what
this quikscript was all about...

Julia

This is the best place for it. I recommend you download the Kingsley manual from this site. The hardest thing I've found and what takes the most time is reading it, not writing it.
 
So writing in a diary is good, if you also go back and read it. The reading will allow you to recognize whole word forms instead of just working out the sounds of individual letters.
 
Another good way to learn it is through reading other's writings.
 
Chuck
